The day gravity disappeared, the world turned upside down—literally. People floated from their homes, drifting like balloons in a child’s birthday party. Sarah, clutching her cat Mr. Whiskers, soared past her neighbor’s garden, where flowers danced freely in the air. Children laughed, somersaulting through the clouds, while adults struggled to grab onto anything solid. In this newfound freedom, Sarah discovered the joy of flight, gliding through the city, painting vibrant rainbows in the sky with her imagination. But as the sun dipped below the horizon, a whisper of gravity returned, pulling her gently back to earth. Life resumed, but the magic lingered.
